description: Students study how an instrument functions mechanically, mathematically, optically, and
electronically, and then how its parts are linked together. Topics covered include basic
electronics and computer interfacing, spectrophotometric instruments, mass spectrometers,
electrochemical instrumentation, and various separation methods.  Offered annually in the
fall semester. Prerequisites: CHEM 255 and CHEM  256; previous or concurrent enrollment in PHYS
